content.title: Digital Ischemia Evaluation
content.definition: A systematic approach to the diagnosis of finger or toe ischemia, encompassing vascular, rheumatologic, hematologic, and environmental causes.

concepts.definition: Signs and symptoms of digital ischemia.

clinical_features.tissue_loss: Ulceration, necrosis, gangrene in severe cases
clinical_features.distribution: Single digit suggests local cause, multiple digits suggests systemic

concepts.definition: Categories of causes for digital ischemia.

clinical_features.vascular: Arterial duplex, digital pressures, cold challenge testing
clinical_features.cardiac: ECG, echocardiography if embolic source suspected
clinical_features.angiography: CTA or conventional angiography for proximal source

clinical_features.vasospastic: Calcium channel blockers, PDE5 inhibitors, smoking cessation
clinical_features.surgical: Sympathectomy, bypass, digital amputation if needed

clinical_features.multidisciplinary: May require vascular surgery, rheumatology, hematology input

content.statement: Digital Ischemia Evaluation is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Upper-Extremity that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
